contentrichtext.text: Three ships of the [[Royal Navy]] have been named '''HMS ''Hogue''''', after the [[Battles of Barfleur and La Hougue|battle of La Hogue]], May 1692: *[[HMS Hogue (1811)|''Hogue'' (1811)]], 3rd rate sail, converted to unarmoured screw vessel 1849, broken up 1865 * [[HMS Hogue (1900)|''Hogue'']] (1900), launched 1900, was a [[Cressy class cruiser|''Cressy''-class]] armoured [[cruiser]], sunk in 1914. * [[HMS Hogue (1944)|''Hogue'']] (1944), launched 1944, was a [[Battle class destroyer|''Battle''-class]] [[destroyer]], scrapped in 1962. {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hogue, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
